intro: Thelasis carinata f. semipelorica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thelasis, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 cm wide. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
